DOC.brief_summary: The project randomize , 3-way , blind crossover trial 20 healthy , fasted participant consume meal 30 g linear corn starch 5 g one seaweed , Laminara digitata Undaria pinnatifida pea protein control . The primary aim investigate whether brown seaweed affect postprandial glucose Area Under Curve ( AUC ) . Stomach empty , insulin , C-peptide , appetite-regulating hormone ( oxyntomodulin , glucagon , GLP-1 PYY ) , specific metabolite seaweed urine plasma well subjective satiety also analyze .
DOC.brief_title: Brown Seaweeds Effect Glucose Tolerance Appetite Response
DOC.detailed_description: Brown seaweed may contain bioactive compound contain secondary plant metabolite , include flavonoid phenolic compound well carotenoid . Dietary fibre major component brown seaweed , mainly compose laminarans , alginates , fucans cellulose . Several dietary fiber secondary plant metabolite show impact health specifically glycemic control . Therefore , aim study investigate whether two select brown seaweed effect postprandial glucose response starch load well several secondary measure , include appetite response . In controlled crossover trial , 20 healthy fast participant consume 5 g either Laminaria digitata ( LD ) Undaria pinnatifida ( UP ) 1 g pea protein ( CTR ) . The volunteer concomitantly ingest 200 mL drink corn starch . Blood sample draw baseline , well 20 , 40 , 60 , 90 , 120 180 min meal . Differences glucose , insulin , C-peptide , plasma incretin concentration , insulin sensitivity index ( ISI ) analyze appetite score visual analogue scale subsequent ad libitum test meal .
DOC.criteria: BMI 2025 kg/m2 . Waist circumference < 102 cm . Nonsmoking . Like ( tolerate ) seaweed , pasta , meat sauce food part test meal . Can tolerate paracetamol ( Pinex , Actavis , Denmark ) . Systemic infection , psychiatric metabolic disease , clinical condition , chronic frequent use medication ( include blood thinner , exclude contraceptive ) , smoke ( throughout trial 12 month start experiment ) , blood donation month lead study period , elite athlete ( > 10 hour hard exercise / week , selfreported ) , high intake alcohol ( defined weekly intake > 7 unit woman > 14 unit men ) , drug addiction , participation scientific study study period , lactating , pregnancy ongoing planning pregnancy , vegetarianism veganism .
